channel.title: RSC 204 Client Remake - C#
channel.description:
Hey there guys!
Most of you have already seen the previous progress posted in the "client modifications" topic. I thought I'd keep you guys updated through my own topic instead.
The initial video I posted http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NSm8mrPGQ_A
newest video http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LDiPVkvKSRI
[img]https://fbcdn-sphotos-g-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-ash3/1044877_10151548495083759_637084495_n.jpg[/img]
[img]https://fbcdn-sphotos-b-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-frc1/1005272_10151551874728759_590541733_n.jpg[/img]
[img]https://fbcdn-sphotos-c-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-frc1/1005282_10151554883018759_621366440_n.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img5.imageshack.us/img5/286/9rwb.png[/img]
Latest Image right now:
[img]http://img96.imageshack.us/img96/1583/s1sc.png[/img]
Task list: 1. Set the proper textures for [s]walls and[/s] ground overlays. [s]2. Object textures[/s] Post-poned. 3. Update the terrain to match the original more. 4. Drawing NPC's [s]Players[/s] and Items 5. User Interface - Currently working on this. 6. Game Controls 7. Networking 8. Combat 9. Dialogs 10. Bug fixes, tweaking and fine tuning 11. Overall experimenting with new shaders, other adjustments. 12. ???? 13. Profit
This client will work on any unmodified MoparClassic Server. :)
[b]All new sprites are made by me.[/b]

item.title: RSC 204 Client Remake - C#
item.dc:creator: @zerratar zerratar
item.description:
@zerratar wrote:

ive had some more updates to the network part of the game. Login is still automated, but other players shows up and disappear as expected. Altough their movements are not updated properly yet.

Walking command works awefully at the moment as the waypoints generated for walking is not super-good. Not using the original RSC code for path generating due to the fact that i’m not completely reading all the necessary tile information of the landscape.

The flags that tells if a tile is walkable or not. So right now players can still generate a pathway through diagonal walls.
World information is loaded correctly and stats for your player aswell. Health, strength, attack, etc. Aswell for experience.

I’m just not done with the character sheet window yet so the only visible information is your health bar and combat level. (Name too of course)
The main thing right now is to get the players being updated properly around you.

Walking and possible chat.
Then i will work on the different body types to be properly used. Hair and skin color. (Skin color will come later though)
Its aaaalmost time for pictures i guess, so I will see if i can do anything about that later today.

Read full topic

item.title: RSC 204 Client Remake - C#
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

Zerratar, other than the models and textures, is there any JaGeX proprietary code used in your C# client? I know that the language is not the same but what I am getting at is this: what exactly is left in your C# client that came from JaGeX’s RSC client? My thought is that if you were to publish an open source version at some point in the future, those interested could match your C# client with an open source server and with enough creativity, effort, and time, could produce a completely “new” MMO without using any of JaGeX’s intellectual property. It would completley avoid the threat of DMCA takedowns and copyright infringement lawsuits that often are imposed on private game server communities in general. While JaGeX has not bothered to challenge RSC private servers that I am aware of, they have been putting a lot of pressure on various RS2 servers from what I have noticed. I recall the other day seeing several RS2 client downloads having been removed off a free file hosting website with the reason stated that they recieved a DMCA takedown request from JaGeX LTD.

I have been interested in taking a very modifiable framework such as a RSC game server and client and designing a uniquely different MMO game that runs on the same game mechanics. My strengths are not in programming yet but I am teaching myself from a JAVA textbook as time permits. What are your thoughts?

Read full topic

item.title: RSC 204 Client Remake - C#
item.dc:creator: @waj waj
item.description:
@waj wrote:

-Nothing:

A while back I was thinking of using 3D models as characters, but I lack the knowledge to do it. I think it’s really awesome to see it done.

I agree. We all have some kind of passion for RSC, some playing some developing. I am bored of seeing the same things in an RSC server and this is RSC but with a very nice twist.

I also think this could turn into something good if its hosted and finished, I for one would be very interested in playing this.

Read full topic

item.title: RSC 204 Client Remake - C#
item.dc:creator: @zerratar zerratar
item.description:
@zerratar wrote:

waj:

Any more updates?

I became a bit inactive in the project when the hype kinda died out here on the forums, but its nice to see that someone is still trying to look up for news and updates.

From what you can see in the video is the “beginning” of the animation process and handling. I’ve currently have fixed the camera to be properly aligned and controlled just like the original RSC one.

Animations for such as Walking and basic attacking are now implemented aswell. Tapping somewhere on the ground will walk you to that area, using a walk animation.
No idle animations yet, will come soon. Aswell for creating suitable equipments to be used

Still need to work a bit on the environment and the section loading (handling loading of sections at the right time).

Network part is also coming a long now and is my current focus. Login are automated but works. This using a MoparClassic server.
The player is seen properly using the original MoparClassic client but not yet updated in this one. (Not a hard task, but as I said it got a bit inactive due to a few reasons, being busy with other projects and work is one of em)

I will share some screenshots and/or possibly a video soon enough.

Read full topic

item.title: RSC 204 Client Remake - C#
item.dc:creator: @zerratar zerratar
item.description:
@zerratar wrote:

[quote=“tigerclan, post:163, topic:518519”][quote author=zerratar link=topic=636785.msg4345838#msg4345838 date=1375865635]
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LDiPVkvKSRI[/youtube]

some small updates. Ive been working on getting animations and dress-able 3d models to work

The model itself is a complete “base”. And what i mean about that is that the base is simply just the body.
The underwear is a seperate model, so is the “rune” plate armor.
Oh yeah, the hair is a seperate model aswell. All changable at runtime
[/quote]

Nice, did you create the models yourself(also, if so, which program did you use). Like the camera angle as well[/quote]

I’m importing and using the same 3d models MikuMikuDance uses, same goes with the animations are also used (MikuMikuDance Motion Data, aka Vocaloid Motion Data, .VMD)

Theres a huge forever-expanding community for that program where everyone seem to make new models. I just took the opportunity to use these models for this project as its extremely easy for me to create new animations and find new useable 3d models.

mikumikudance.wikia.com

MikuMikuDance Wiki

View this template

DeviantArt

Browse Popular All Time | DeviantArt

Popular All Time - Your spot for viewing some of the best pieces on DeviantArt. Be inspired by a huge range of artwork from artists around the world.

Read full topic
